messages.title: A Record of Action, A Promise of More
messages.content: Cambridge deserves more than party-focused politics.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Worked to bring £23.2million to local schools and addressing the funding imbalance that our area receive less funding than other parts of the country.
Voted against my party's plans when they would hurt Cambridge, including on tuition fees, increases action in Iraq and Syria, and controversial NHS reforms.
Fought to ensure every infant child receives a free school meal, and will keep working to bring free meals to all primary school children.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour won't win a majority – every poll points to another coalition government.

issues.education: Worked to bring £23.2million to local schools and addressing the funding imbalance that our area receive less funding than other parts of the country.
issues.health: Voted against my party's plans when they would hurt Cambridge, I said no to tuition fee increases, military action in Iraq and Syria, and controversial NHS reforms.
issues.socialWelfare: Fought to ensure every infant child receives a free school meal, and will keep working to bring free meals to all primary school children.

leaflet.personalStatement: Cambridge deserves more than party-focused politics.

politicalExperience.achievements: Argued for real changes to help Cambridge including education funding and action on social welfare.

contactInformation.address: 16 Signet Court, Swann's Road, Cambridge CB5 8LA

images.caption: Julian Huppert engaging with members of the community.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes the candidate’s record and promises for the future, focusing on the candidate being a local individual rather than a politician.
